intro: Indigofera anabibensis, commonly known as the Ethiopian indigo plant, is a flowering plant species native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and ability to fix nitrogen in the soil. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale purple, and it has compound leaves with a pinnate structure. Indigofera anabibensis is often found in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and potential medicinal contexts.
